results.title: Metformin and testosterone replacement therapy inversely associated with hormone-associated cancers (prostate, colorectal and male breast cancers) among older White and Black men.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: We found independent and joint associations of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and TTh with incident @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate@@@ (odds ratio [OR]joint  = 0.44, 95% confidence interval [CI]: 0.36-0.54) and @DISEASE_Colorectal_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D015179 @@@colorectal cancers@@@ (ORjoint  = 0.47, 95% CI: 0.34-0.64), but not with @DISEASE_Breast_Neoplasms_Male @DISEASE_MESH:D018567 @@@male breast cancer@@@.

results.title: Validating drug repurposing signals using electronic health records: a case study of metformin associated with reduced cancer mortality
results.text_hl: Many site-specific @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancers@@@ including @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@breast, colorectal, lung, and prostate@@@ demonstrated reduced mortality with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ use in at least one EHR.

results.title: Metformin as an anti-cancer agent: actions and mechanisms targeting cancer stem cells.
results.text_hl: Studies using various @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ models, including @DISEASE_Hereditary_Breast_and_Ovarian_Cancer_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D061325 @@@breast@@@, @DISEASE_Pancreatitis @DISEASE_MESH:D010195 @@@pancreatic@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Prostatitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011472 @@@prostate@@@, and colon, have demonstrated the potency of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in attenuating CSCs through the targeting of specific pathways involved in cell differentiation, renewal, @DISEASE_Neoplasm_Metastasis @DISEASE_MESH:D009362 @@@metastasis@@@, and metabolism.

citations.NLM: Saini N, Yang X. Metformin as an anti-cancer agent: actions and mechanisms targeting cancer stem cells. Acta Biochim Biophys Sin (Shanghai). 2018 Feb 1;50(2):133-143. PMID: 29342230
